metadata.description:
This data set contains the observation data of vorticity correlativity from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016 of the super station at the upper reaches of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in caoban village, aru township, qilian county, qinghai province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.4643e, 38.0473n and 3033m above sea level.The rack height of the vortex correlativity meter is 3.5m, the sampling frequency is 10Hz, the ultrasonic orientation is due north, and the distance between the ultrasonic wind speed and temperature meter (CSAT3) and CO2/H2O analyzer (Li7500A) is 15cm.
The original observation data of the vortex correlativity instrument is 10Hz, and the published data is the 30-minute data processed by Eddypro software. The main processing steps include: outliers, delay time correction, coordinate rotation (quadratic coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction and density (WPL) correction.Quality assessment for each intercompared to at the same time, mainly is the atmospheric stability (Δ st) and turbulent characteristics of similarity (ITC) test.The 30min pass value output by Eddypro software was also screened :(1) data when instrument error was eliminated;(2) data of 1h before and after precipitation are excluded;(3) remove the data with a missing rate of more than 10% in the original 10Hz data within every 30 minutes;(4) the observation data of weak turbulence at night (u* less than 0.1m/s) were excluded.The average observation period was 30 minutes, 48 data per day, and the missing data was marked as -6999.Suspicious data caused by instrument drift and other reasons are marked with red font, in which Li7500A calibration data of vorticity system from April 30 to May 1 is missing;When 10Hz data is missing due to a problem with the memory card storage data (11.9-11.24), the data will be replaced by 30min flux data output by the collector.
The published observational data include:Date/Time for the Date/Time, wind Wdir (°), Wnd horizontal wind speed (m/s), standard deviation Std_Uy lateral wind speed (m/s), ultrasonic virtual temperature Tv (℃), the water vapor density H2O (g/m3), carbon dioxide concentration CO2 (mg/m3), friction velocity Ustar) (m/s), Mr. Hoff length L (m), sensible heat flux Hs (W/m2), latent heat flux LE (W/m2), carbon dioxide flux Fc (mg/(m2s)), the quality of the sensible heat flux identifier QA_Hs, the quality of the latent heat flux identifier QA_LE,Quality indicator for co2 flux QA_Fc.The quality of the sensible heat and latent heat, carbon dioxide flux identification is divided into three (quality id 0: (Δ st < 30, the ITC < 30);1: (Δ st < 100, ITC < 100);The rest is 2).The meaning of data time, such as 0:30 represents the average of 0:00-0:30;The data is stored in *.xls format.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al. (2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日的黑河水文气象观测网上游阿柔超级站的涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县阿柔乡草达坂村，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4643E, 38.0473N，海拔3033m。涡动相关仪的架高3.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3）与CO2/H2O分析仪（Li7500A）之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识，其中4月30-5月1日涡动系统Li7500A标定数据缺失；当存储卡存储数据出现问题导致10Hz数据缺失时(11.9-11.24)，数据由采集器输出的30min通量数据替代。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组成温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，与EC系统的测量值相比，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
research objective: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China.
This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.
challenges: However, several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. However, the above modeling efforts suffered from 1) the availability of the forcing data (only two weather stations operated by the Chinese Meteorological Administration functioned in the upper reaches of the HRB) and 2) a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization.
Unfortunately, this did not work well due to the influence of strong wind. Therefore, snow density data, which can be calculated using snow depth and SWE data, are not available at present.
methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.
dataset: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中扮演着重要角色，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些都需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，从而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖分布广泛，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于获取数据的困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着以下问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS，以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟，以及遥感观测。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors cause challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous environments?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在异质环境中收集生态水文过程多尺度观测的挑战的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes are primarily caused by the poor availability of multiscale observations, the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography. These factors inhibit complete and consistent data collection, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测面临的挑战主要是由于多尺度观测的可用性差、寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形。这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集，从而妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is accurate estimation of component temperatures crucial for the performance of the two-source energy balance model?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么准确估计组件温度对于双源能量平衡模型的性能至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurate estimation of component temperatures is crucial for the two-source energy balance model because errors in the derived component temperature, primarily caused by image classification errors, can lead to overestimation of canopy temperature. This affects the model's performance in estimating evapotranspiration, particularly in strongly advective conditions, as the model's performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 组件温度的准确估计对于双源能量平衡模型至关重要，因为由图像分类错误引起的派生组件温度的误差，可能导致对冠层温度的过高估计。这会影响模型在估算蒸散发时的表现，特别是在强烈的平流条件下，因为模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温度差异的不确定性的影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, and how does it affect hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致高山地区观测数据稀缺的原因是什么，以及这对水文模型有何影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is caused by difficulties of access, technological barriers, and harsh environmental conditions. This scarcity hinders alpine hydrological modeling and associated research by limiting the availability of high-quality data for parameterization and validation, which is essential for accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难、技术障碍和恶劣的环境条件所导致的。这种稀缺性限制了阿尔卑斯水文模型和相关研究，因为缺乏高质量的数据用于参数化和验证，而这些数据对于准确估计和预测水文过程至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential impacts on data accuracy when integrating multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中整合多尺度观测时，数据准确性可能受到的影响有哪些？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale observations can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing comprehensive data for model validation, but it also introduces challenges such as data scarcity in alpine regions and potential uncertainties in remote sensing data, which require careful validation and calibration.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度观测可以通过提供全面的数据用于模型验证，从而改善水文过程的预测，但这也带来了挑战，例如在高山地区的数据稀缺以及遥感数据可能存在的不确定性，这需要仔细的验证和校准。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the availability of high-resolution thermal infrared imagery affect the estimation of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热红外影像的可用性如何影响异质景观中蒸散发的估算？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The availability of high-resolution thermal infrared imagery improves the estimation of evapotranspiration by providing accurate soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for separating soil and vegetation latent heat fluxes and enhancing the reliability of models like the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热红外影像的可用性提高了蒸散发的估算，因为它提供了准确的土壤和冠层温度，这对于分离土壤和植被的潜热通量至关重要，从而增强了像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using a distributed and multiscale observation network for alpine hydrology research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用分布式和多尺度观测网络进行阿尔卑斯水文研究的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a distributed and multiscale observation network allows for the collection of comprehensive datasets on hydrometeorological, snow, and frozen ground processes, which are essential for providing accurate forcing data for hydrological models, validating remote sensing products, and improving the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in the alpine region.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用分布式和多尺度观测网络可以收集关于水文气象、雪和冻土过程的综合数据集，这对于提供水文模型的准确强迫数据、验证遥感产品以及提高对高山地区水文过程的预测理解至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary goals behind establishing a multiscale observation network in heterogeneous alpine regions for hydrological studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质高山地区建立多尺度观测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goals include providing accurate forcing data for hydrological models, validating remote sensing data, evaluating distributed models, and improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions by capturing detailed multiscale eco-hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标包括为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，以及通过捕捉详细的多尺度生态水文过程，改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to utilize a combination of ground-based measurements and remote sensing data in the estimation of evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在估算异质地表的蒸散量时，结合使用地面测量和遥感数据很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Utilizing a combination of ground-based measurements and remote sensing data is important to improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates, especially in heterogeneous landscapes. This approach allows for the validation of surface fluxes and the separation of evapotranspiration components with better accuracy, ensuring more reliable model outputs and contributing to effective water resource management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 利用地面测量和遥感数据的结合对于提高蒸散发估算的准确性至关重要，尤其是在异质景观中。这种方法可以验证表面通量，并更准确地分离蒸散发成分，从而确保模型输出的可靠性，并有助于有效的水资源管理。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the development of datasets for investigating the impact of climate perturbations on alpine hydrological processes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 推动开发用于研究气候扰动对高山水文过程影响的数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include understanding how climate change and human activities alter hydrological processes, providing comprehensive datasets for model development and evaluation, and addressing scientific questions related to alpine hydrology, particularly concerning snow cover and frozen ground dynamics, which are crucial for sustaining downstream ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括理解气候变化和人类活动如何改变水文过程，提供用于模型开发和评估的综合数据集，以及解决与高山水文学相关的科学问题，特别是关于雪盖和冻土动态的问题，这对维持下游生态系统至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key procedural steps involved in processing eddy covariance data for hydrometeorological observations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理涡度相关数据以进行水文气象观测的关键步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The key procedural steps for processing eddy covariance data include: removing outlier values, delay time correction, coordinate rotation (secondary coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, quality assessment of flux values is conducted, primarily testing atmospheric stability (Δst) and turbulence similarity characteristics (ITC). Eddypro software is typically used to process 10Hz raw data into 30-minute averages, and data during instrument errors, rainfall, or when data loss exceeds 10% in 30-minute periods are excluded.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 处理涡动协方差数据的关键程序步骤包括：去除异常值、延迟时间校正、坐标旋转（次级坐标旋转）、频率响应校正、超声波虚温校正和密度（WPL）校正。此外，还对通量值进行质量评估，主要测试大气稳定性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）。通常使用EddyPro软件将10Hz的原始数据处理为30分钟的平均值，并排除在仪器故障、降雨或30分钟内数据丢失超过10%的情况下的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can multiscale observations be collected to address the challenges of eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何收集多尺度观测数据以应对异质表面上生态水文过程的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations can be collected using a hierarchical and distributed observation network, which includes deploying eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and using airborne remote sensing technologies like LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and thermal imagers. These instruments capture diverse eco-hydrological processes at multiple scales, from local to regional, facilitating comprehensive data collection about interactions between oasis and desert systems.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测可以通过分层和分布式观测网络进行收集，其中包括部署涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站，以及使用航空遥感技术如激光雷达、成像光谱仪和热成像仪。这些仪器在多个尺度上捕捉多样的生态水文过程，从局部到区域，促进了关于绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的全面数据收集。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches are used to capture snow cover and frozen ground processes in alpine regions, and how are these integrated into broader hydrometeorological datasets?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，捕捉雪盖和冻土过程的方法论方法有哪些？这些方法如何融入更广泛的水文气象数据集？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Methodological approaches include establishing an integrated observation network that utilizes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. Techniques involve using instruments like SR50A for snow depth, GammaMONitor (GMON) for snow water equivalent, and FlowCapt for blowing snow measurements. These data are integrated into broader datasets by monitoring meteorological variables, snow accumulation, and freeze-thaw processes, supporting the development and validation of alpine hydrological models and remote sensing products.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 方法论包括建立一个综合观测网络，利用自动气象站和超级站进行雪和冻土观测。技术涉及使用SR50A仪器测量雪深，GammaMONitor (GMON)测量雪水当量，以及FlowCapt测量吹雪。这些数据通过监测气象变量、雪积累和冻融过程整合到更广泛的数据集中，支持高山水文模型和遥感产品的开发与验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of multiscale hydrometeorological data in alpine and oasis-desert regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高山和绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度水文气象数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Recent advancements such as the use of high-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies, including LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, have enabled the collection of multiscale hydrometeorological data. Additionally, the establishment of an integrated observation network with automatic meteorological stations and superstations in alpine regions has facilitated comprehensive data collection.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 最近的进展，如高分辨率航空遥感技术的应用，包括激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，使得多尺度水文气象数据的收集成为可能。此外，在高山地区建立的自动气象站和超级气象站的综合观测网络也促进了全面数据的收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary to establish a robust data collection network for capturing eco-hydrological processes in high-altitude and complex terrains?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 建立一个强大的数据收集网络以捕捉高海拔和复杂地形中的生态水文过程所需的条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: To establish a robust data collection network in high-altitude regions, it is necessary to deploy a combination of automatic meteorological stations, superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, and a wireless sensor network. The network should be capable of capturing spatially distributed meteorological variables and should be supported by remote sensing data for validation and analysis. Addressing challenges such as harsh climate conditions and technological barriers is also crucial.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 为了在高海拔地区建立一个强大的数据收集网络，有必要部署自动气象站、用于雪和冻土观测的超级站以及无线传感器网络。该网络应能够捕捉空间分布的气象变量，并应通过遥感数据进行验证和分析。解决恶劣气候条件和技术障碍等挑战也至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in alpine regions face significant challenges despite advances in technology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管技术取得了进步，为什么在高山地区的数据收集可能面临重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions is challenged by the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These factors hinder the development and deployment of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models, leading to a scarcity of observation data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，数据收集受到寒冷和恶劣气候、高海拔以及复杂地形的挑战，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。这些因素妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展和部署，导致观测数据的稀缺。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are some reasons that multiscale observations are difficult to obtain for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质表面上获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测有哪些困难的原因？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are difficult to obtain due to the poor availability of data across different scales. The challenges include the complexity of capturing eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces and the limitations in effectively integrating data from hierarchically nested scales to provide comprehensive insights.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测难以获得，因为在不同尺度上数据的可用性较差。挑战包括在异质表面上捕捉生态水文过程的复杂性，以及在有效整合来自分层嵌套尺度的数据以提供全面见解方面的局限性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be discrepancies between estimated and observed component temperatures in energy balance models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在能量平衡模型中，估计的组件温度与观察到的组件温度之间可能存在差异的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in estimated and observed component temperatures can arise from errors in image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance, and the misclassification of soil pixels as vegetation pixels. Such errors lead to overestimation of canopy temperature, affecting the model's performance, especially in strongly advective irrigated areas.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 估计和观测的组成温度之间的差异可能源于图像分类中的错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，以及将土壤像素错误分类为植被像素。这些错误导致对树冠温度的过高估计，影响模型的性能，尤其是在强烈的灌溉区域。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you believe the current methodologies are in addressing the uncertainties in component temperature estimation within the two-source energy balance model?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为当前的方法在解决双源能量平衡模型中组件温度估计的不确定性方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The methodologies, while advanced, face limitations, especially in arid regions. The TSEB model's performance is mainly affected by uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences, often caused by errors in determining component temperatures. These errors arise from image classification issues and atmospheric radiation factors. However, the use of high-resolution thermal cameras and ground-based measurements can improve the estimation, though challenges persist in strongly advective environments.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 这些方法虽然先进，但在干旱地区面临局限性。TSEB模型的性能主要受到地表与空气温度差异的不确定性影响，这通常是由于确定组成部分温度时出现的错误。这些错误源于图像分类问题和大气辐射因素。然而，使用高分辨率热像仪和地面测量可以改善估计，尽管在强烈的平流环境中仍然存在挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the challenges faced in collecting multiscale observational data for eco-hydrological research in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度观测数据以进行生态水文研究所面临的挑战的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes. HiWATER attempts to address this with a hierarchically nested observation system, but challenges persist due to the logistical difficulties of instrument deployment and data collection across varied landscapes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战是多尺度观测的可用性差，这阻碍了生态水文过程的上尺度研究。HiWATER试图通过分层嵌套的观测系统来解决这个问题，但由于在不同地貌上仪器部署和数据收集的后勤困难，仍然存在挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how crucial is the integration of remote sensing with ground-based measurements for improving hydrological models in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，将遥感与地面测量相结合对于改进高山地区的水文模型有多重要？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integration is crucial due to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, which are difficult to access. Remote sensing, combined with data assimilation, can enhance predictions of hydrological processes, although it must overcome uncertainties specific to these regions. An integrated observation network, like the one in the Heihe River Basin, is essential to provide accurate data for modeling and to understand the impacts of climate change and human activities on these processes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 由于高山地区观测数据稀缺，整合显得尤为重要。这些地区难以到达，遥感结合数据同化可以提高水文过程的预测能力，尽管必须克服这些地区特有的不确定性。像黑河流域这样的综合观测网络对于提供准确的建模数据以及理解气候变化和人类活动对这些过程的影响至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets are processed to differentiate between soil and vegetation components in complex landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何处理数据集以区分复杂景观中的土壤和植被成分。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The TSEB model uses observed soil and canopy component temperatures from high-resolution thermal cameras and applies the Craig–Gordon model to partition evapotranspiration into its soil and vegetation components. This involves classifying soil and canopy pixels using images and calculating component temperatures from thermal infrared data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: TSEB模型利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度，并应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发分解为土壤和植被组件。这涉及使用图像对土壤和冠层像素进行分类，并从热红外数据中计算组件温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used for hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground observations in alpine regions, focusing on their technological and operational challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于高山地区水文气象、雪盖和冻土观测的数据收集方法，重点关注它们的技术和操作挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions involves using a combination of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs), superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, and remote sensing technologies. The challenges include cold and harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topographies that inhibit consistent data collection. Instruments used include ultrasonic sensors for snow depth, GammaMONitor for snow water equivalent, and FlowCapt for blowing snow measurement. The data collection is further complicated by the need to validate and calibrate remote sensing data due to uncertainties.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集涉及使用自动气象站（AMS）、用于雪和冻土观测的超级站以及遥感技术。挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素妨碍了一致的数据收集。使用的仪器包括超声波传感器用于雪深测量、GammaMONitor用于雪水当量测量，以及FlowCapt用于吹雪测量。数据收集还因需要验证和校准遥感数据而变得更加复杂，因为存在不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the strategies for expanding and refining datasets related to evapotranspiration estimation models, focusing on the integration of ground-based and remote sensing data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查与蒸散发估算模型相关的数据集扩展和精炼策略，重点关注地面观测数据和遥感数据的集成。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Evapotranspiration estimation models, such as the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, benefit from integrating ground-based measurements like eddy covariance system data with remote sensing data. Ground-based soil and canopy component temperatures, measured with high-resolution thermal cameras, are used to refine model inputs and improve validation. The challenge lies in accurately separating soil and canopy temperatures and handling uncertainties in radiometric data, which can be addressed by using stable isotope techniques and advanced classification methods for image data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 蒸散发估算模型，如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，通过将地面测量（如涡度协方差系统数据）与遥感数据相结合而受益。使用高分辨率热像仪测量的地面和冠层组件温度被用来优化模型输入并改善验证。挑战在于准确分离土壤和冠层温度以及处理辐射数据的不确定性，这可以通过使用稳定同位素技术和先进的图像数据分类方法来解决。
